results.title: A Baseball Trip to Mexico City. But First, a Pilgrimage.
results.abstract: When in the capital for road games, many Mexican League players join the throngs paying their respects at the Basílica de Santa María de Guadalupe.
results.byline: By James Wagner and Alejandro Cegarra

multimedia.caption: Isidro Piña, a professional baseball player for the Olmecas de Tabasco, organized a trip with his teammates Mario Morales and Daniel Nuñez to the Basílica de Santa María de Guadalupe.

results.title: ESPN Enters Sports Gambling in $2 Billion Deal With Casino Company
results.abstract: ESPN Bet will be operated by Penn Entertainment, which said it was selling its platform’s previous brand, Barstool Sports, back to its founder.

multimedia.caption: In a 10-year deal, Penn Entertainment will pay ESPN $1.5 billion in cash and offer $500 million in stock purchase options.
multimedia.copyright: Yana Paskova for The Washington Post, via Getty Image

results.title: Hoping to Stay in the Shohei Ohtani Business
results.abstract: Rather than trade away the game’s best player, Los Angeles tried to get him some help. Now the struggling team has to wait — and hope.

results.title: The Messy Relationship Between Romance Novels and Ice Hockey
results.abstract: Hockey romance is a thriving literary subgenre, but some of its fans on TikTok are creating content that blurs the line between fictional players and real-life ones, dividing the community.

multimedia.caption: In July, Felicia Wennberg, far right, said that explicit social media posts about her husband, Alex Wennberg of the Seattle Kraken, left, had “crossed the line.”
In July, Felicia Wennberg, far right, said that explicit social media posts about her husband, Alex Wennberg of the Seattle Kraken, left, had “crossed the line.”

results.title: A Tiny Gap Reveals a Yawning One for the U.S. Women’s Team
results.abstract: The idea that the United States was eliminated from the Women’s World Cup by a millimeter is an illusion. Denying that will only guarantee more failures.
org_facet: United States Women's National Soccer Team

results.title: A New Generation of Oriole Magic
results.abstract: One of the youngest and cheapest rosters in Major League Baseball has powered Baltimore to the best record in the American League. The Orioles are just getting started.

multimedia.caption: Gunnar Henderson, left, and Adley Rutschman were both minor leaguers at the start of the 2022 season. They have led Baltimore to the best record in the American League this season.

results.title: From the Women’s World Cup to Wimbledon, a Victory Everyone Can Share
results.abstract: Across sports, female athletes are fighting a battle over what they put on their bodies and how much of those bodies they display.

results.abstract: A missed penalty kick was a cruel way to draw down the curtain on a star’s World Cup career. But her influence and legacy were never about soccer alone.

results.title: How the U.S. Was Eliminated From the World Cup, Shot by Shot

results.title: The N.B.A. Player Who Might See His Mom at Union Meetings
results.abstract: Jaren Jackson Jr. is active in the N.B.A. players’ union. His mother, Terri, works for the W.N.B.A. players’ union. When he was elected vice president, she did her best not to embarrass him.

results.title: She’s One of the Fastest Women Ever. All She’s Missing Is a Gold Medal.
results.abstract: Marie-Josée Ta Lou of Ivory Coast has been milliseconds away from the top of Olympic and World Championship podium stands. She has a chance at redemption this month in Budapest.

results.title: Llegan a Ciudad de México a jugar beisbol. Pero antes, peregrinan
results.abstract: La religión tiene un papel muy visible en los deportes latinoamericanos. Y algunos peloteros que juegan en la capital mexicana tienen una tradición: visitar a la Virgen de Guadalupe.
results.byline: By James Wagner and Alejandro Cegarra

results.title: Netherlands Holds Off South Africa, Squeezing Into World Cup Quarterfinals
results.abstract: A goal in each half delivered victory, and a date with Spain. But a South Africa striker made the day as difficult as possible.

results.title: World Cup Picks Up Baton for Women’s Sports in Australia
results.abstract: For as long as there have been sports in Australia, women have clamored to play and participate. But winning visibility, and support, has been a long road.

results.title: Studying the Limits of Human Perfection, Through Darts
results.abstract: Why do athletes always seem to get better, generation by generation? It’s not always for the reasons you might think.
results.byline: By Ben Blatt and Courtney Cox

results.title: ‘Winning Time’ Is Back. Here’s What to Know Ahead of Season 2
results.abstract: Season 1 of HBO’s series about the 1980s Lakers came with drama, in more ways than one. Expect more for Season 2. An N.B.A. reporter takes a look.

results.title: Jan Frodeno Begins His Triathlon Farewell Tour. Up Next? More Risky Sports.
results.abstract: Frodeno, 41, has dominating the triathlon since winning Olympic gold in 2008. This will be his last competitive season.

multimedia.caption: “I’m a professional athlete. It’s not a job. It’s my calling. It’s who I am,” Jan Frodeno said. He is retiring after this season.
